ai-sn38:1.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying in the land of the Magadhans near the little village of Nālaka.
ai-sn38:1.1.2_0: Then the wanderer Jambukhādaka went to Venerable Sāriputta,
ai-sn38:1.1.2_1: and after going, he exchanged greetings with him.
ai-sn38:1.1.3_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-sn38:1.1.3_1: He bowed, sat down to one side, and said to Sāriputta,
ai-sn38:1.2.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘extinguishment’.
ai-sn38:1.2.3_0: “Reverend, the ending of greed, hate, and delusion
ai-sn38:1.2.5_0: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for realizing this extinguishment?”
ai-sn38:1.2.8_0: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-sn38:1.2.9_0: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
ai-sn38:1.2.10_0: This is the path, the practice, for realizing this extinguishment.”
ai-sn38:1.2.11_0: “Reverend, this is a fine path, a fine practice, for realizing this extinguishment.
ai-sn38:1.2.12_0: But it’s enough to be diligent.”
ai-sn38:2.1.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘perfection’.
ai-sn38:2.1.3_0: “Reverend, the ending of greed, hate, and delusion
ai-sn38:2.1.5_0: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for realizing this perfection?”
ai-sn38:2.1.8_0: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-sn38:2.1.10_0: This is the path, the practice, for realizing this perfection.”
ai-sn38:2.1.11_0: “Reverend, this is a fine path, a fine practice, for realizing this perfection.
ai-sn38:2.1.12_0: But it’s enough to be diligent.”
ai-sn38:3.1.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, who speaks in accordance with the Teaching, who are practicing well?”
ai-sn38:3.1.2_0: “Reverend, those who teach principles for giving up greed, hate, and delusion have principled speech in the world.
ai-sn38:3.1.3_0: Those who practice for giving up greed, hate, and delusion are practicing well in the world.
ai-sn38:3.1.4_0: Those who have given up greed, hate, and delusion—so they’re cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future—are Holy Ones in the world.”
ai-sn38:3.2.1_0: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for giving up that greed, hate, and delusion?”
ai-sn38:3.2.4_0: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-sn38:3.2.6_0: This is the path, this is the practice for giving up that greed, hate, and delusion.”
ai-sn38:3.2.7_0: “This is a fine path, a fine practice, for giving up greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-sn38:3.2.8_0: But it’s enough to be diligent.”
ai-sn38:4.1.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, what’s the purpose of leading the spiritual life under the ascetic Gotama?”
ai-sn38:4.1.2_0: “The purpose of leading the spiritual life under the Buddha is to completely understand suffering.”
ai-sn38:4.1.3_0: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for completely understanding this suffering?”
ai-sn38:4.2.1_0: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-sn38:4.2.3_0: This is the path, the practice, for completely understanding this suffering.”
ai-sn38:4.2.4_0: “This is a fine path, a fine practice, for completely understanding this suffering.
ai-sn38:4.2.5_0: But it’s enough to be diligent.”
ai-sn38:5.1.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘gaining solace’.
ai-sn38:5.1.2_0: At what point do you gain solace?”
ai-sn38:5.1.3_0: “When a mendicant truly understands the six fields of contacts’ origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape, at that point they’ve gained solace.”
ai-sn38:5.1.4_0: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for realizing this solace?”
ai-sn38:5.1.7_0: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-sn38:5.1.9_0: This is the path, the practice, for realizing this solace.”
ai-sn38:5.1.10_0: “Reverend, this is a fine path, a fine practice, for realizing this solace.
ai-sn38:5.1.11_0: But it’s enough to be diligent.”
ai-sn38:6.1.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘gaining ultimate solace’.
ai-sn38:6.1.2_0: At what point do you gain ultimate solace?”
ai-sn38:6.1.3_0: “When a mendicant is freed by not grasping after truly understanding the six fields of contacts’ origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape, at that point they’ve gained ultimate solace.”
ai-sn38:6.1.4_0: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for realizing this ultimate solace?”
ai-sn38:6.1.7_0: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-sn38:6.1.9_0: This is the path, the practice, for realizing this ultimate solace.”
ai-sn38:6.1.10_0: “Reverend, this is a fine path, a fine practice, for realizing this ultimate solace.
ai-sn38:6.1.11_0: But it’s enough to be diligent.”
ai-sn38:6.1.12_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-sn38:7.1.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘feeling’.
ai-sn38:7.1.7_0: “But reverend, is there a path and a practice for completely understanding these three feelings?”
ai-sn38:7.1.10_0: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-sn38:7.1.12_0: This is the path, this is the practice for completely understanding these three feelings.”
ai-sn38:7.1.13_0: “This is a fine path, a fine practice, for completely understanding these three feelings.
ai-sn38:7.1.14_0: But it’s enough to be diligent.”
ai-sn38:8.1.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘defilement’.
ai-sn38:8.1.4_0: The defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.
ai-sn38:8.1.6_0: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for completely understanding these three defilements?”
ai-sn38:8.1.9_0: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-sn38:8.1.11_0: This is the path and the practice for giving up these defilements.”
ai-sn38:8.1.12_0: “This is a fine path, a fine practice, for giving up these defilements.
ai-sn38:8.1.13_0: But it’s enough to be diligent.”
ai-sn38:9.1.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘ignorance’.
ai-sn38:9.1.3_0: “Not knowing about suffering, the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.
ai-sn38:9.1.5_0: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for giving up that ignorance?”
ai-sn38:9.1.8_0: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-sn38:9.1.10_0: This is the path, this is the practice for giving up that ignorance.”
ai-sn38:9.1.11_0: “This is a fine path, a fine practice, for giving up ignorance.
ai-sn38:9.1.12_0: But it’s enough to be diligent.”
ai-sn38:10.1.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘craving’.
ai-sn38:10.1.4_0: craving for sensual pleasures, craving for continued existence, and craving to end existence.
ai-sn38:10.1.6_0: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for completely understanding these cravings?”
ai-sn38:10.1.9_0: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-sn38:10.1.11_0: This is the path, this is the practice for giving up that craving.”
ai-sn38:10.1.12_0: “This is a fine path, a fine practice, for giving up these cravings.
ai-sn38:10.1.13_0: But it’s enough to be diligent.”
ai-sn38:11.1.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘a flood’.
ai-sn38:11.1.4_0: The floods of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.
ai-sn38:11.1.6_0: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for completely understanding these floods?”
ai-sn38:11.1.9_0: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-sn38:11.1.11_0: This is the path and the practice for giving up these floods.”
ai-sn38:11.1.12_0: “This is a fine path, a fine practice, for giving up these floods.
ai-sn38:11.1.13_0: But it’s enough to be diligent.”
ai-sn38:12.1.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘grasping’.
ai-sn38:12.1.3_0: “Reverend, there are these four kinds of grasping.
ai-sn38:12.1.4_0: Grasping at sensual pleasures, views, precepts and observances, and theories of a self.
ai-sn38:12.1.5_0: These are the four kinds of grasping.”
ai-sn38:12.1.6_0: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for completely understanding these four kinds of grasping?”
ai-sn38:12.1.9_0: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-sn38:12.1.11_0: This is the path and the practice for giving up these four kinds of grasping.”
ai-sn38:12.1.12_0: “This is a fine path, a fine practice, for giving up these five grasping aggregates.
ai-sn38:12.1.13_0: But it’s enough to be diligent.”
ai-sn38:13.1.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of these things called ‘states of existence’.
ai-sn38:13.1.3_0: “Reverend, there are these three states of existence.
ai-sn38:13.1.5_0: These are the three states of existence.”
ai-sn38:13.1.6_0: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for completely understanding these three states of existence?”
ai-sn38:13.1.9_0: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-sn38:13.1.11_0: This is the path, this is the practice for completely understanding these three states of existence.”
ai-sn38:13.1.12_0: “Reverend, this is a fine path, a fine practice, for completely understanding these three states of existence.
ai-sn38:13.1.13_0: But it’s enough to be diligent.”
ai-sn38:14.1.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘suffering’.
ai-sn38:14.1.3_0: “Reverend, there are these three forms of suffering.
ai-sn38:14.1.4_0: The suffering inherent in painful feeling; the suffering inherent in conditions; and the suffering inherent in perishing.
ai-sn38:14.1.5_0: These are the three forms of suffering.”
ai-sn38:14.1.6_0: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for completely understanding these three forms of suffering?”
ai-sn38:14.1.9_0: “The noble eightfold path is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-sn38:14.1.11_0: This is the path, the practice that leads to the complete understanding of suffering.”
ai-sn38:14.1.12_0: “This is a fine path, a fine practice, for completely understanding these three forms of suffering.
ai-sn38:14.1.13_0: But it’s enough to be diligent.”
ai-sn38:15.1.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘identity’.
ai-sn38:15.1.3_0: “Reverend, the Buddha said that these five grasping aggregates are identity. That is,
ai-sn38:15.1.4_0: form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.
ai-sn38:15.1.5_0: The Buddha said that these five grasping aggregates are identity.”
ai-sn38:15.1.6_0: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for completely understanding this identity?”
ai-sn38:15.1.9_0: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-sn38:15.1.11_0: This is the path, the practice, and the complete understanding of identity.”
ai-sn38:15.1.12_0: “Reverend, this is a fine path, a fine practice, for completely understanding identity.
ai-sn38:15.1.13_0: But it’s enough to be diligent.”
ai-sn38:16.1.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, is there difficult to do in this teaching and training?”
ai-sn38:16.1.2_0: “Going forth, reverend, is hard to do in this teaching and training.”
ai-sn38:16.1.3_0: “But what’s hard to do for someone who has gone forth?”
ai-sn38:16.1.4_0: “When you’ve gone forth it’s hard to be satisfied.”
ai-sn38:16.1.5_0: “But what’s hard to do for someone who’s hard to do?”
ai-sn38:16.1.6_0: “When you’re satisfied, it’s hard to practice in line with the teaching.”
ai-sn38:16.1.7_0: “But if a mendicant practices in line with the teaching, will it take them long to become a perfected one?”
ai-sn38:16.1.10_0: The Linked Discourses with Jambukhādaka are complete.
ai-sn38:16.2.7_0: hard to do in this teaching and training,
